question.title: Robot class in Javafxml
question.body:
I am a beginner, and I have a question regarding Robot class in JavaFX. I have the following code.

Basically, when I manually click on AnchorPane, method click gets activated, and when the mouse enters the AnchorPane, method entered gets fired.

My problem is that when the mouse enters the AnchorPane the output is always:

entered!
You clicked me!

How can I make sure that "entered" prints after Robot class automatically clicks (and therefore "You clicked me!" gets printed first) on AnchorPane?

I really appreciate if you can help me.

public class FXMLDocumentController implements Initializable {
    
    @FXML public AnchorPane canvas;
    
    public void click() {
        System.out.println("You clicked me!");
    }

    public void entered() throws AWTException, InterruptedException {
        Robot robot1 = new Robot();
        robot1.mousePress(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK);
        robot1.delay(10);
        robot1.mouseRelease(InputEvent.BUTTON1_MASK);
        System.out.println("entered!");
        
    }
    
    @Override
    public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle rb) {
        // TODO
        canvas.setOnMouseClicked( (event) -> {
            click();
        });
        canvas.setOnMouseEntered( (event) -> {
            try {
                entered();
            } catch (AWTException ex) {
                Logger.getLogger(FXMLDocumentController.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
            } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
                Logger.getLogger(FXMLDocumentController.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
            }
        });
    }    
    
}
